transcript.title: Board of Ed. of Independent School Dist. No. 92 of Pottawatomie Cty. v. Earls

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We'll hear argument now in number oh oh oh, pardon me oh one three thirty-two, the Board of Education of Independent School District number ninety-two of Pottawatomie County versus Lindsay Earls.
Ms. Meoli M- m- Meoli I guess.
Is that is that the correct pronunciation?
Meoli.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Meoli, okay.
The third time is the charm.
[Inaudible]
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

This case involves the constitutionality of the Tecumseh School Board's decision to implement a suspicionless drug testing pro- policy for students in competitive activities as a reasonable response to student drug use.
Tecumseh's policy represents a natural, logical, and rational application of this Court's decision in Vernonia V Acton.
Vernonia's policy applied to students who chose to participate in interscholastic athletics.
Tecumseh's policy applies as well to athletics, but also to all the other competitive activities that are offered by the district.
Respondents do not challenge the policy as applied to the athletics, conceding that this Court approved that practice in Vernonia.
Competitive...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, this policy goes beyond what was permitted in Vernonia, does it not?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It greatly expands...
Well, it covers...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the number of students covered by the policy.
It it covers a wider variety of interscholastic competitive activities.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And the evidence is not as strong, i- is it, in this case of drug use in the school as as was the case in Vernonia?
Well, Your Honor, we do not believe that is true.
Well, if you...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: go by the district court's findings, that's what you'd conclude.
e- i- The district court in Vernonia?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: In this case.
In this case.
What do you --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the young people who were involved in these particular extracurricular activities?
Yes, we do have evidence of drug use w- i- with these students in extracurricular activities.
In...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: of the the reports that have been filed up to the eve of the adoption of this regulation by the school district with the Feds, year after year after year, saying, things are fine here? The only thing we have to worry about is is some beer.
No, Your Honor, I don't think they were lying.
Federal grants...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: were they were saying at the same time that they didn't have a problem with with what we usually refer to as drugs.
They said it e- it wasn't a major problem at that time.
And and in point of fact,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: as I understand it, e- since the testing has been carried out among the the class of people subject to this challenge, there have been only three instances of of any drug use found.
From the from the drug testing?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: it seems to me that your evidentiary problem is up to the eve of adopting the regulation, the school district was saying, we don't have a problem.
Let me a- answer the second part first.
But the important piece...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the existence of a policy might be expected to deter drug use so that you would have fewer i- instances after it was imposed.
Y- yes, Your Honor, and in and in...
fact really it...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: know, will we?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, l-
let her...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: answer the question, will you?
Your Honor, in fact, it it really did.
Ms. Meoli, d-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: didn't we say in Vernonia e- that in Skinner, which was the th- railroad employee testing case, we did not demand that it be shown that the particular railroad had a drug problem? Didn't we say it was enough that there was a nationwide problem?
Yes, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We...
said that in...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Skinner, and we adverted to that in Vernonia.
And i- and Vernonia's evidence as well showed that there was not a specific drug problem among athletes.
Among...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I thought the argument in Vernonia and I thought the opinion in Vernonia, in assessing the particular interest of the district, repeatedly emphasized the particular problems with the athletes.
And I'm not saying that, Your Honor.
But isn't that the implication...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: of what you're...
saying?
No, Your Honor, I don't.
Except for one startling difference...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The e- in e- n- there was a problem with athletes.
Well, e- e- Your Honor, we have never said that the the students in interscholastic competitive activities are the only students or even the most likely students to be abusing drugs.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, I'm...
quotin-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I'm referring specifically to page one hundred and one hundred and one of the joint appendix where the question is whether the students who tend to be indevolved [: involved] in drugs are the ones most likely to be choosing extracurricular activities.
That was the testimony of the of the board president, Dean Rogers.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Where is that testimony?
I think it is at page a hundred and six, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We had no basis for saying yes or no.
Well, e- e- yes, he sa- he says that initially, and then he goes on to say, I just know that all age levels, all categories categories if we're categorizing the students that frequent the park.
Yes, but he's not...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: saying, as was the case in Vernon- Vernonia, that here is a group that we can identify that has this problem.
Y- your Honor, the use of ed- of of drugs among the students in competitive activities was just one of the factors as to why the Tecumseh board selected that group.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So...
or or prevent parents from bring persecuted...
Well, if if you want...
You don't You don't have to go that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: far, do you, d- in...
in order...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to in order to justify limiting it to those who participate in in voluntary activities?
No, Your Honor.
It seems to me...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you could say even if we could drug test anybody, we made the choice of giving a student who feels that strongly about not undergoing drug testing the ability to avoid it by simply not engaging in the extracurricular activities.
Yes, yes,
Your Honor. I...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: valid argument I I suppose an equally valid argument would i- for for testing everybody would be our object is to stop drug use, not to penalize people who go out for band.
i- i- Your Honor, the i- the p- the purpose of this program is not to discipline students.
those students...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: drug use among those who do not go out for band?
Yes, Your Honor, I I I...
believe we do.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: good that you can test everybody?
W- well, number one, I I think there is a deterrent effect for implementing this program among the student general student body.
If they want to -- no-
I- if they want to try out or d- or aud- audition for one of those competitive activities, they know in advance that one of the regulations i- i- i- is to be subjected...
to drug testing.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: what you're arguing is is is a justification for the present policy that you've got, and I understand your position there.
in.
Well, I think there is a an a reasonably good argument for that.
No, I I realize...
even if we utilize the balancing test that was utilized in Vernonia, I I think there is a...
really good argument...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: then the whole notion of special need has has, more or less, evaporated.
I suppose the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: distinction that you draw is based on the fact that you have a sanction for the people that you apply it to.
E- exactly, Your Honor, and and that really is our position because...
we c- have...
to educate the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you impose is you just can't play in the band or or cheerlead or whatever it is...
they want to do.
You can remain in the class.
So, you have a special...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: burden if you want to engage in extracurricular activities.
yes, Your Honor.
Well, how about...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: taking elective classes, classes that the State doesn't require you to take, but some students might like to take?
Well, Your Honor, we had to draw a line somewhere, and and e- even though elective...
classes are a choice...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the line that you would draw as a question of the school's policy, but you were saying i- at least you see a problem with testing everyone because people are compelled to go to school and so th- that's why you resisted drawing the line there.
My question is if...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you're doing a voluntary, then why don't you say as well, you volunteer for you're taking a certain course, this is elective course.
Well well, elective courses are really mandatory, Your Honor, in many cases.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Except for that, it'd be a good idea, though, wouldn't it?
Ye- i- Yes Your Honor.
What I thought you'd s-
if we could fashion a way to do it, I believe the majority of school boards would be behind it.
extracurricular --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Is there any other sanction other than i- oth- other than ineligibility for extracurricular extracurricular activities? Is there any other sanction imposed on a student who is found to've been using drugs?
No no, Your Honor, and in fact, that only happens in this policy under the third time...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So, really the student could say, well, the worst is a- if I g- go out for ecert- extracurricular activities and get caught, it'll be it'll be back where if I hadn't gone out at all.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: gets back wh- to square one.
W- well, I think g- I think children who engage in these activities really want to compete.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Could you,
for...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that reason, adopt as a as one of your sanctions or a supplementary sanction simply publicity that the person had been caught? Anybody who fails the drug test will have his name and photograph posted on the bulletin board.
I I I think it would be...
very cruel, Your Honor.
As to whether...
so whether it is constitutional or not I we're we're not in in in the job of disciplining students.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Very well, Ms. Meoli.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Suppose you've had a s- s- hard statistical evidence to show that the kids that go out for the extracurricular activities are the ones that d- really do not use drugs, that the high drug user population is in those that don't engage in the activities.

I I think in a case like that, it still might be appropriate for the school district to test the students involved in extracurricular activities, and I think that is because, as this Court has emphasized on a number of occasions, by making the the the testing program applicable only to an avoidable activity, the the school district would be ensuring the reasonableness of the program under the Fourth...
Amendment.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: there're some we we had an amicus brief by some pediatrics association and so forth that pointed out that students that engage in these extracurricular activities are, indeed, the least likely to be involved in drug use.
Well a co-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It's so counterintuitive, isn't it?
A couple of points in response to that, Justice O'Connor.
t- school wide.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: face of a school district that h- certifying to the Federal Government they don't have a drug problem.
Well, I don't think it's that odd, Justice O'Connor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, if alcohol's the problem, why don't they address that? This is just I I I mean, i- it's structured in a way to do very little good it seems...
to me.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: do you think any school in the country doesn't have a drug problem?
I would be surprised to find a school district that didn't.
Can Can you tell me...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Skinner and Von Raab, we imposed or we permitted the imposition of drug testing on the basis of a nationwide problem, didn't we, without without showing that the particular entity in question shared in that national problem?
That's correct, Justice Scalia.
Well, d- do you...
drug counseling, I'm not sure they want to ask him w- what groups are...
you in.
May I ask?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: What is your view on the v- on the validity of a a school wide drug testing program?
Justice Stevens, we think such a program would be constitutional, but we think the...
Your view differs...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: from the petitioner's then.
You We We do have that difference, but we think a program like this is constitutional for three reasons.
Second, as I...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: they agree to it.
Two points, Justice Souter.
But it it doesn't...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you a question that that is concern concerns me about the difference between this case and Vernonia? If we if we look at what people might expect in the real world, where people know that athletes, professional athletes, Olympic athletes, athletes are tested for drugs, but people who are just everyday people aren't.
Well, I I mean, I th- I think i- w- one fact is that I think it is increasingly becoming true that these these sorts of policies are in in society as a whole.
recognize...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: y- you would make and I think you've said this the same argument if they had decided to have a universal drug testing policy in the school.
I I would, Justice Souter.
reasonableness.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: th- that point, I I the the so called special need has become virtually a universal need.
I I would like to say two things in response to that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And and the special need would be a universal need in every school in the United States.

I I I do think it would properly recognize that the school context is different, and that school boards have a freer hand in testing their students than the Government has testing either employees or it's...
citizens at large.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that is the case, what is the danger in the school case, comparable to the to the railroad worker's danger or the the the customs officer's danger? What is the danger as distinct from simply the desire to deter illegal drug use?
I think the danger is this.
But in fr-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: getting young people used to a drug culture.
I agree with that, Justice Scalia, and I would I would add that this is not the only context where where where the Federal Government has recognized that difference.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: hardly a revelation that the Government is concerned about what drugs do to our culture.
A- Absolutely, and I think it's...
perfectly...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: rocket science, is it?
No, and I and I don't think it's rocket science also to say that that that concern is particularly acute with respect to the youngest and most vulnerable members of society.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Clement.

Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court Opposing counsel said we have to draw the line somewhere, and the way the way to draw the line in this case is to keep in mind the core principle that individualized reasonable suspicion is the standard for school searches set forth in TLO.
the core of TLO...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: individualized suspicion in Vernonia.
There there was not, and Vernonia is...
Well, so...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: so there goes your principle.
Th- Vernonia is the exception to the TLO rule.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Can have medical metal detectors in schools where they're afraid the children have guns?
Yes, they can.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Now, there's no individualized suspicion there, is...
No, there's not,
and the reason...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: throat swabs if you feel that there is a contagious disease?
Throat swabs if you think there's a contagious disease.
I was trying to f- well, that's...

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: what I I raised that because, of course, everyone is making a criminal law analogy,
but nobody's arrested here.
Well...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Nobody is arrested.
Well...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and and I just wonder.
Well, unless the Court stands ready to overrule TLO, I believe it is the standard.
observa-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: it's absolutely clear there isn't individualized suspicion, so you win automatically if that's the test, I would think.
Well...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: course, it wasn't in Vernonia.
Of of course.
being drug tested.

text_blocks.text: presumably a year round thing in a way that football is not.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

The competi-

text_blocks.text: me let me ask y- ask you this.
Mhm.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and that's what's happening here.
Well, Justice Kennedy, you're absolutely right.
I need to p-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: me if a school is better than other school districts s- s- insofar as drug use, they have less drug use, that they're maybe entitled to keep it that way.
Well...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to say not.
Well, there there're couple of things.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But they have a record here that, of course, suggests if you want to know if drugs are going on in your school, you ask the kids.
Well...
And...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I don't really see how that de- re- I mean, you know, you might be able to drive a millimeter of light between that and Vernonia.
Well, J-
